sentences.text: January 27, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to join us at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Annual Meeting) of The Cooper Companies, Inc., which will be held at 8:00 a.m. (PDT) on March 13, 2017 at The Rose Hotel, 807 Main Street, Pleasanton, California.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting we will ask our stockholders to vote on proposals to elect a Board of Directors, ratify the Audit Committees appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm for the current fiscal year and approve an executive incentive plan governing cash incentive awards for our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also ask our stockholders to take advisory votes on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers and the frequency with which we present such advisory votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us and we hope that you will take this opportunity to participate in the affairs of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we urge you to read the accompanying materials that discuss matters to be voted on and to use either the proxy card or voting instruction form provided to you to submit your vote by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information about voting your shares is included in the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to seeing you at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A. Thomas Bender Chairman of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE COOPER COMPANIES, INC. 6140 Stoneridge Mall Road, Suite 590 Pleasanton, CA 94588
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting Date:  Monday, March 13, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Location:   The Boardroom at The Rose Hote 807 Main Street Pleasanton, California 94566
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Admission:  All stockholders are cordially invited to attend the meeting in perso
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elect the nine directors named in the Proxy Statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 31, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approve the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hold an advisory vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hold an advisory vote on the frequency with which we present advisory votes on our executive compensation programs; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transact any other business that may properly come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record at the close of business on Tuesday, January 17, 2017, or their legal proxy holders, will be entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about January 31, 2017, we will mail either (1) a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) containing instructions on how to access an electronic copy of our proxy materials and vote your shares or (2) a copy of this Proxy Statement and our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice will also contain instructions on how to request a paper copy of our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by following the instructions on the Notice or by using the proxy card accompanying the paper copy of materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If phone or internet voting is available to you, instructions will be included on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of whether you plan to attend the meeting, we encourage you to vote your shares as soon as possible to ensure that your vote is recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to your participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carol R. Kaufman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE COOPER COMPANIES, INC. 6140 Stoneridge Mall Road, Suite 590 Pleasanton, CA 94588
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will hold our Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Annual Meeting) on Monday, March 13, 2017 in The Boardroom at The Rose Hotel, 807 Main Street, Pleasanton, California.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will start at 8:00 a.m. (PDT).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSALS TO BE PRESENTED AT THE ANNUAL MEETING    Our Board      Recommends:          Proposal 1:       Election of nine Directors (p. 55)       FOR       Proposal 2:      Ratification of KPMG LLP as our Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm (p.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 61)       FOR       Proposal 3:       Approval of the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan (p.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 62)       FOR       Proposal 4:       Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation (p. 68)       FOR       Proposal 5:      Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Presentation of Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation (p. 70)        ANNUAL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed information regarding each of these proposals is presented in this Proxy Statement starting on page 54.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information about us, our Board and its committees, equity ownership, compensation of officers and directors, and other matters can be found starting on page 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not aware of any other business to be brought before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any additional business is properly brought before the meeting, the designated officers serving as proxies will vote in accordance with their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement was provided to all stockholders of record at Tuesday, January 17, 2017 and is presented on our behalf by order of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It contains information about our Company and the proposals to be presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also furnished our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K to all stockholders of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Report contains our financial statements for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016 and other useful information, but it is not part of the materials for the solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also find useful information about the Company on our website at http://www.coopercos.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information contained on our website is not, and should not be considered, a part of this Proxy Statement or any other filing or report filed with or furnished to with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strongly encourage you to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of whether you plan to attend the meeting, we encourage you to read this Proxy Statement and the accompanying materials and to vote your shares as soon as possible to ensure that your vote is recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to your participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Record Date for this years Annual Meeting is January 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders who owned our stock at the close of business on the Record Date are entitled to receive proxy materials and to vote at the Annual Meeting and any continuations, adjournments or postponements thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the Record Date, there were 48,923,304 shares of our common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes do I have?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each outstanding share of our common stock is entitled to one vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have one vote per share that you owned at the close of business on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote your shares in person at the Annual Meeting or vote by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The method of voting by proxy differs for shares held as a record holder and shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares of common stock as a record holder you may vote your shares by following the instructions on the Notice, or by completing, dating and signing the proxy card included with this Proxy Statement and promptly returning it in the pre-addressed, postage paid envelope provided to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If phone or internet voting is available to you, instructions are included in the Notice or on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares of common stock in street name, which means your shares are held of record by a broker, bank or other nominee, you will receive the proxy materials from your broker, bank or other nominee with instructions on how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your broker, bank or other nominee may allow you to deliver your voting instructions by phone or through the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to vote your shares in person you may do so by attending the Annual Meeting and requesting a ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What happens if I vote my shares by proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When you return a completed proxy card, or vote your shares by telephone or internet, you authorize our officers listed on the proxy card to vote your shares on your behalf as you direct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign and return a proxy card but do not provide instructions on how to vote your shares, the designated officers will vote on your behalf as recommended by the Board:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares will be voted FOR each of the individuals nominated to serve as directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares will be voted FOR ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 31, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares will be voted FOR the approval of the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares will be voted FOR the compensation of our Named Executive Officers as described in this Proxy Statement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares will be voted for the ANNUAL presentation of an advisory vote on our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change or revoke my vote after I return my proxy card or voting instructions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to vote your shares by proxy, you may revoke or change your vote at any time prior to the casting of votes at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To revoke or change your vote, you may take any of the following actions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Execute and submit a new proxy card;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Submit new voting instructions through telephonic or internet voting, if available to you;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Notify Carol R. Kaufman, Secretary of the Company, in writing that you wish to revoke your proxy; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Vote your shares in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attending the Annual Meeting in person will not automatically revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes must be present to hold the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to conduct business and have a valid vote at the Annual Meeting a quorum must be present in person or represented by proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum is defined as a majority of the shares outstanding on the Record Date and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Delaware law and our Bylaws, broker non-votes and proxies reflecting abstentions will be considered present and entitled to vote for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are broker non-votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes occur when a broker is not permitted to vote on behalf of shares it holds for a beneficial owner and the beneficial owner does not provide voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held in a brokers name may be voted by the broker, but only in accordance with the rules of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under those rules, the broker must follow the instructions of the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If instructions are not provided, NYSE rules determine whether the broker may vote the shares based on its own judgment or is required to withhold its vote, and the determination depends on the proposal being voted on.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the proposals to be presented at the Annual Meeting, broker discretionary voting is only permitted for the ratification of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Q&A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a one-page notice in the mail regarding the internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC permits us to provide our proxy materials electronically if you have not previously requested to receive only printed materials on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, on or about January 31, 2017, we mailed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice includes instructions on how to access the proxy materials over the internet or to request a printed copy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice was sent to our stockholders of record at January 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders receiving the Notice have the ability to access the proxy materials electronically through the website referred to in the Notice, and they also have the option to request a printed set of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage stockholders to take advantage of the availability of proxy materials on the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I vote my shares by filling out and returning the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice only identifies the items to be voted on at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You cannot vote by marking the Notice and returning it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice provides instructions on how to cast your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who pays for the proxy solicitation and how will the Company solicit votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay all costs associated with the solicitation of proxies, including any costs incurred by brokers and other fiduciaries to forward proxy solicitation materials to beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may solicit proxies in person or by mail, telephone, facsimile or e-mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may be solicited on our behalf by any of our directors, officers or employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we have retained the firm of D.F. King & Co., Inc. to assist with the solicitation of proxies and will pay a fee of $16,500 for this service, plus reasonable costs and expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I communicate with the Board of Directors?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any interested party can contact our Board to provide comments, to report concerns, or to ask a question, at the following address:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carol R. Kaufman Executive Vice President, Secretary, Chief Administrative Officer & Chief Governance Officer The Cooper Companies, Inc. 6140 Stoneridge Mall Road, Suite 590 Pleasanton, CA 94588
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications are distributed to the Board, or to any individual directors as appropriate, depending on the facts and circumstances outlined in the communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also communicate online with our Board of Directors as a group through our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to our website at http://www.coopercos.com for any changes in this process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER PROPOSALS AND NOMINATIONS FOR DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC rules and our Bylaws permit stockholders to nominate directors for election and to propose other business to be considered by stockholders at the Annual Meeting under various mechanisms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be considered at the 2018 Annual Meeting, director nominations or other proposals must be submitted in writing to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carol R. Kaufman, Secretary The Cooper Companies, Inc. 6140 Stoneridge Mall Road, Suite 590 Pleasanton, CA 94588
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals to be presented under Rule 14a-8:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals under Rule 14a-8 must be submitted no later than October 3, 2017 to be included in our next Proxy Statement and considered at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations and Proposals Submitted Under Bylaw Provisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals under our Bylaws must be submitted no earlier than November 13, 2017 and no later than December 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that we set the date for the 2018 Annual Meeting more than 30 days before or more than 70 days after March 13, 2018, submissions may be made no earlier than the close of business on the 120th day prior to the announced meeting date and no later than the close of business on the later of the 90th day prior to the announced meeting date and the 10th day following our first public disclosure of the date of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Director Nomination Proposals:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee will consider director nominees suggested by stockholders on the same terms as nominees selected by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 8 for information about the Committees criteria for director nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The person recommending the nominee must be a stockholder entitled to vote at the 2018 Annua Meeting, and recommendations must be received in writing between November 13, 2017 and December 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be considered, recommendations must include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the nominees written consent to being named in the Proxy Statement and to serve as a director if elected;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the name and address of the stockholder submitting the recommendation or beneficial owner on whose behalf the proposed candidate is being suggested for nomination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a statement of the proposed nominees qualifications to serve as director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the class and number of our shares owned by the stockholder or beneficial owner submitting the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we increase the number of directors to be elected at the 2018 Annual Meeting with less than 100 days notice prior to March 13, 2018 stating the size of the increase and naming all the nominees for director, then stockholder nominations for directors will be considered if the proposal is delivered to our Secretary at our principal offices no later than 10 days after we make a public announcement of the increased board size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This only applies to nominations for positions created by the increase and does not apply to nominations for current positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Securities Held by Insiders

sentences.text: The Board and its committees conduct regular self-evaluations and review director ndependence and committee composition to ensure continued compliance with regulations.

sentences.text: Under our Corporate Governance Principles, directors are not permitted to serve on the boards of more than two other public companies while they serve on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not limit service on private company boards of directors or with non-profit organizations.

sentences.text: Identification of Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee is responsible for identification and selection of qualified candidates for nomination to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that nominees for election to he Board must possess certain minimum qualifications and attributes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be nominated for election, an individual must:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) meet the objective independence requirements set forth by the SEC and NYSE (other than executive nominees);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) exhibit strong personal integrity, character, and ethics and a commitment to ethical business and accounting practices;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) not serve on more than two other public company boards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) not be involved in on-going litigation with us or be employed by an entity which is engaged in such litigation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) not be the subject of any on-going criminal investigations, including investigations for fraud or financial misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee does not currently maintain a separate diversity policy regarding nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead the Committee relies on diversity as one of many factors in he consideration of director nominees who meet these stated criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee will consider suggestions from stockholders for nominees for election as directors at our Annual Stockholder Meetings on the same terms as
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: nominees selected by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder suggestions must be received on a timely basis and meet the criteria set forth in the information on Stockholder Proposals and Nominations for Director on page 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, no stockholder suggestions for director nominees have been received by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as set forth above, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee does not currently have a formal process for identifying and evaluating nominees for directors, including nominees recommended by stockholders.

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain separate positions for the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain an independent Lead Director position, which is currently held by Dr. Allan E. Rubenstein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We feel this division provides a balance between the independence of our directors and the experience of our officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Chairman has significant business experience with the Company, but has also been affirmatively determined to be independent by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We feel that maintaining an independent Chair provides for strong, knowledgeable leadership of the Board separate from the CEO positions immediate, day-to-day involvement with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board maintains four standing committees as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee membership is determined by the Board and reviewed regularly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the SEC and NYSE, all members of our Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, Audit Committee, and Organization and Compensation Committee are independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Boards discretion, other committees may include directors who have not been determined to be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently the Board maintains one committee, the Science and Technology Committee, which has non-independent director membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee maintains a written charter detailing its authority and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These charters are updated periodically as legislative and regulatory developments and business circumstances warrant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee charters are available in their entirety on our website at http://www.coopercos.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee provides advice with respect to our financial matters and assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities regarding:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the quality and integrity of our financial statements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) review of our potential risk factors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the qualifications, independence, and performance of the independent registered public accounting firm serving as auditors of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) retention and engagement of the independent registered public accounting firm, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) the performance of the Companys Internal Audit function and internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee advises and makes recommendations to the Board regarding our financial, investment and accounting procedures and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee reviews and approves all aspects of the compensation paid to our Chief Executive Officer and all executives identified by the Organization and Compensation Committee as officers under Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee also approves all compensation for employees whose total combined annual base salary plus target non-equity incentive bonus is $500,000 or greater, regardless of whether they have been designated as officers under Section 16(a).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Organization and Compensation Committee are not eligible to participate in any of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee also approves the composition of our designated comparative peer group for compensation review, approves all awards under our equity and non-equity incentive bonus plans, and has approval authority for all agreements providing for the payment of benefits following a change in control of the Company, severance following a termination of employment or any other special arrangement with the executive officers or employees which would affect their compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee also oversees succession planning and management development programs designed to strengthen our internal pool of candidates for executive level positions and promote mentoring of senior level employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee develops, implements, and maintains the corporate governance standards by which we conduct business, and advises and makes recommendations to the Board concerning our primary governance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee meets with the Chief Executive Officer and senior corporate staff as it deems appropriate to fulfill its obligations with regard to our corporate governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee also performs the functions described under Identification of Candidates on page 8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Science and Technology Committee evaluates new and existing technologies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Science and Technology Committees primary functions are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) discuss technology that falls outside the usual scope of current business,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) periodically review our research and development projects and portfolio,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) annually review our key technologies and assess the position of these technologies versus third party products and processes, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) provide information and guidance to the Board on matters relating to science and technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Science and Technology Committee functions on an ad hoc basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an ongoing commitment to good governance and business practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this commitment, we regularly monitor developments in the area of corporate governance and review our policies and procedures in light of such developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to comply with the rules and regulations promulgated by the SEC and the NYSE and implement other corporate governance practices we believe are in the best interest of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In keeping with this commitment, our corporate Bylaws include a majority voting standard for the election of our directors and we maintain various corporate policies that reflect our dedication to good governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the policies currently in place enhance our stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has approved a set of Corporate Governance Principles for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Principles are available in their entirety on our website at http://www.coopercos.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Principles set out our standards for director qualifications, director responsibilities, Board committees, director access to officers and employees, director orientation and continuing education, and performance evaluations of the Chief Executive Officer and of the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Principles also address compensation and stock ownership requirements for our Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These topics are discussed in more detail in the section on Director Compensation starting on page 50.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ethics and Business Conduct Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted an Ethics and Business Conduct Policy, or Ethics Policy, which is available in its entirety on our website at http://www.coopercos.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All our employees, officers, and directors, including the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, are required to adhere to the Ethics Policy in discharging their work-related responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are encouraged to report any conduct that they believe in good faith to be an actual or apparent violation of the Ethics Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Ethics Policy includes provisions relating to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) conflicts of interest;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the protection and proper use of Company assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) relationships with customers, suppliers, competitors and associates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) government relations and anti-corruption regulations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) and compliance with laws and regulations, including laws and regulations relating to insider trading, equal employment opportunity, harassment, health and safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We most recently updated the Ethics Policy in July 2014 with revisions to enhance readability and to provide additional detail regarding the Companys expectations regarding the conduct of our employees, officers and directors and reporting of violations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Ethics Policy is translated into multiple languages to facilitate readability for our employees and all employees receive a copy of the Ethics Policy both at their date of hire and annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Ethics Policy is also posted on our internal web pages for ease of access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendments to the Ethics Policy and any waivers from the Ethics Policy granted to directors or executive officers will be made available through our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this proxy statement, no waivers or requests have been requested or granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Trading Policy: Hedging & Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have implemented a Stock Trading Policy that applies to our senior executives, including our Named Executive Officers, and all members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Policy, trading in Company securities is prohibited except during specifically designated windows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, executives and members of the Board are prohibited from engaging in various trading practices which would suggest speculation in our securities, including short sales, puts, calls, forward sales, equity swaps or other hedging transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy does permit executives and members of the Board to pledge securities as collateral, but only upon prior notice to, and approval from, the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Procedures for Handling Accounting Complaints
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has established procedures for receipt and handling of potential complaints we may receive regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, and to allow for the confidential, anonymous submission by our employees of concerns regarding accounting or auditing matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this goal, we have established a confidential reporting system managed by an independent third-party vendor through which employees may report concerns about our business practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reporting system provides both a telephone hotline and online reporting options in multiple languages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recognizes the importance of appropriate oversight of potential business risks in running a successful operation and meeting its fiduciary obligations to our business and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our management team has responsibility for the day-to-day assessment and management of potential business risks, the Board maintains responsibility for creating an appropriate culture of risk management and setting the proper tone at the top.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this function, the Board, directly and through its committees, takes an active role in overseeing our aggregate risk potential and in assisting management with addressing specific risks, including competitive, legal, regulatory, operational and financial risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee of the Board regularly reviews risks related to its area of focus as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews potential risks within our financial operations, information technology systems and internal controls;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee reviews potential risks in relation to general governance and compliance matters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee reviews risks associated with retention of key executives, how our compensation practices influence executive risk taking, and matters of succession planning; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Science and Technology Committee reviews potential risks in connection with current technology and potential technology investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee reports regularly to the Board on these topics and contributes to the overall Board review of potential business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that its current leadership structure and majority independent membership facilitate risk oversight by combining experienced leadership with independent direction from the Board and committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both our Chairman and our CEO have in-depth understanding of our history and specific challenges we face as a business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEOs experience allows him to promptly identify and raise key business risks to the Board and our Chairmans history with the Company provides the Board with an independent voice who can also provide insight into management decisions and market dynamics based on our specific business operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the balance between our Chairman, CEO, Lead Director, and the independent committees of the Board enhances our risk oversight process and appropriately limits levels of risk within our enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we maintain both an internal Risk Committee and a Chief Governance Officer position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Risk Committee is composed of members of senior management and is responsible for the review of our potential and identified business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular reports from the Risk Committee are presented to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Governance Officer holds responsibility for ensuring compliance training and communication of key policies to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board feels that the appointment of executive officers that are directly responsible for monitoring risk and compliance issues ensures active positions dedicated to the identification of potential business risks and enhances the tone at the top message of the importance of risk oversight, governance and compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk and Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Organization and Compensation Committee reviews and assesses the possible risks related to our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this assessment, the Organization and Compensation Committee has concluded that our compensation program structure does not create unreasonable risk or the likelihood of a material adverse impact on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination, the Organization and Compensation Committee considered possible compensation-based risks and means by which potential risks may be mitigated, including through the operation of our internal control structure and the Committees oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee also considered the structure of our compensation plans, including the use of a combination of short- and long-term compensation programs, equity ownership guidelines for our senior executives, capped bonus targets under short-term incentive plans, and clawback provisions for short-term bonus awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least annually, and more often as deemed appropriate, the Organization and Compensation Committee meets with management to discuss plans for CEO succession as well as possible succession plans for senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession plans are designed to allow for an orderly transition of the top executive posts either in the ordinary course of business or in response to emergency situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management develops and presents plans for identification, mentoring and continuing development of appropriate leadership skills for internal candidates for CEO and other
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: leadership positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee provides oversight, input and recommendations with regard to the criteria to be used for identification of potential candidates for succession to leadership positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also meets with individual members of management occasionally throughout the year to assess leadership development within the executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Party Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review all relationships and transactions in which the Company and our directors and executive officers or their immediate family members are participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys legal and governance staff is primarily responsible for monitoring and obtaining information from the directors and executive officers with respect to related person transactions and for then determining, based on the facts and circumstances, whether the Company or a related person has a direct or indirect material interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG LLP, as our independent registered public accounting firm, reviews our controls around the identification and reporting of related party transactions as required by current accounting standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee of our Board reviews and approves or ratifies all transactions between the Company and related persons that are required to be disclosed under SEC rules, and we disclose such transactions in our Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have determined that there were no material related party transactions during the 2016 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the 2016 fiscal year, all of the members of the Organization and Compensation Committee were independent directors, no member was an employee or former employee of the Company, and no Committee member had any relationship requiring disclosure as a related party transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, none of our executive officers served on the compensation committee (or its equivalent) or board of directors of another entity whose executive officer served on the Organization and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our executive officers, directors, and anyone owning more than ten percent of a registered class of our equity securities to file reports with the SEC detailing their ownership and any changes in ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC regulations also require these persons to provide us with a copy of all reports filed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely on our review of the copies of reports and related amendments we have received, we believe that during and with respect to the 2016 fiscal year, all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to our officers, directors and greater-than-ten-percent owners were met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee currently has four members: Jody S. Lindell (Chair), Michael H. Kalkstein, William A. Kozy, and Gary S. Petersmeyer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that all members of the Audit Committee are independent directors and are financially literate as required by the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has also determined that Ms. Lindell meets the qualifications of an audit committee financial expert as defined by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates under a written charter adopted by the Board in December 2003 and most recently amended in March 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees charter is available in its entirety on our website at http://www.coopercos.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees primary duties and responsibilities relate to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reliability and integrity of our accounting policies and financial reporting and financial disclosure practices;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishment and maintenance of processes by Management to assure that an adequate and effective system of internal controls exists within the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engagement, retention and termination of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee provides advice with respect to our financial matters and assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities regarding:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the quality and integrity of our financial statements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) review of our potential risk factors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the qualifications, independence and performance of KPMG LLP (KPMG), in its role as our independent registered public accounting firm,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) retention and engagement of KPMG, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) the performance of our internal audit function and review of our internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for the Companys internal controls and the financial reporting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has engaged Ernst & Young LLP (EY), to assist in the assessment of the Companys internal controls over financial reporting and to provide internal audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such services provided by EY are jointly directed by management and the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG, as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, is responsible for performing an independent audit of the Companys consolidated financial statements in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) and to issue a report on the audit process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees responsibility is to monitor and oversee these processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this context, the Audit Committee has met and held discussions with management and KPMG regarding the fair and complete presentation of the Companys financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee held 8 meetings during the 2016 fiscal year, including regular meetings in conjunction with the close of each fiscal quarter, during which the Audit Committee reviewed and discussed the Companys financial statements with management and KPMG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Audit Committee meetings routinely include executive sessions of the committee, as well as private sessions with each of KPMG, Internal Audit, EY and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviewed and discussed the audited consolidated financial statements of the Company for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016 with management and KPMG, and management represented to the Audit Committee that the Companys consolidated financial statements were prepared in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with KPMG the matters required to be discussed by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board Auditing Standard No. 16 Communication with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also reviewed and discussed with KPMG, Internal Audit, EY and management the processes and procedures associated with our assessment of internal controls over financial reporting, including managements assessment of such controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee maintains policies and procedures for the pre-approval of work performed by KPMG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Audit Committee must approve all engagements in advance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All engagements with estimated fees above $150,000 require consideration and approval by the full Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of the Audit Committee has the authority to approve on behalf of the full Audit Committee all engagements with fees estimated to be below $150,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management recommendations are considered in connection with such engagements, but management has no authority to approve engagements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the 2016 fiscal year, the Audit Committee received both the written disclosures and the letter from KPMG that are mandated by applicable requirements regarding the independent registered public accounting firms communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence and the Audit Committee discussed KPMGs independence from the Company with the lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee or its Chair approved all audit services provided by KPMG for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total fees paid or payable to KPMG for the last two fiscal years are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes our philosophy, strategies, policies and practices for compensating our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization and Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors (referred to below as the Compensation Committee) oversees our executive compensation program and regularly reviews our program to ensure that we maintain an effective link between pay and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee monitors for compensation-related risks that could have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This oversight responsibility is described in more detail throughout this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, including information regarding our compensation governance policies and practices, the outcome of our most recent stockholder advisory vote on named executive officer compensation (the Say-on-Pay vote), the use of compensation consultants, and the selection and composition of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Year in Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial and Operational Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Financial Highlights    Revenue:    $1.967 billion    Up 9.4%        CooperVision:      $1.577 billion        Up 6.0%      CooperSurgical:        $389.6 million        Up 26.0%  EPS:    $5.59    Up 35%  Non-GAAP EPS:    $8.44    Up 13%  Free Cash Flow:    $357 million    Up 51%   Stock Price:    $176.04    Up 16%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the continuing leadership and talent of our Named Executive Officers, we achieved record levels of revenue and cash flow and double-digit earnings per share growth in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is consistent with our history of strong financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to strong financial results, we had a number of important achievements this past year, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were selected to join the Standard & Poors 500 index as part of the healthcare sector in September 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We renegotiated our credit agreement and revolving term loan with KeyBank in March 2016, resulting in significant savings and increased flexibility for future investments in the business globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CooperVision, our contact lens business, grew 8% while the market grew 3%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This growth was driven by several significant product launches globally, including the launch of our new Energys product which is designed to reduce screen fatigue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Single use silicone hydrogel contact lens products grew 48% (in constant currency) and we saw continued growth for other modalities as well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expanded manufacturing capacity with the successful launch of new facilities in the United Kingdom and Costa Rica, and we completed the integration of Sauflon Pharmaceuticals manufacturing and distribution operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expanded the services provided to eye care professionals in the U.S. and Europe to include subscription services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CooperSurgical, our womens healthcare business, closed a number of strategic acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fertility business continues to grow steadily through the acquisition and integration of genetic testing businesses, including acquisitions of Genesis Genetics and Recombine in the U.S. and Reprogenetics UK in England.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were named one of the 40 Best Companies for Leaders by Chief Executive Magazine (6th consecutive year) and one of the Top Workplaces by the Bay Area Newsgroup (5th consecutive year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our manufacturing facility in Puerto Rico received the Presidents Award for Occupational Health and Safety (4th consecutive year) and also received a Platinum Award: Recycling and Innovative Project of the Year from the Puerto Rico Manufacturers Association for efforts to improve recycling and reuse of materials in the manufacturing process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate wellness program ranked as one of the top 10 programs in the San Francisco Bay Area for small employers (6th consecutive year) and CooperVision ranked as one of the top 30 programs for mid-size employers (2nd year consecutive year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CooperVision facility in New York received the Wealth of Health award for the Rochester area (3rd consecutive year) and is the most awarded company in the area for wellness and we received Gold or Platinum Achievement recognition from the American Heart Association as a Fit-Friendly Company at all of our U.S. locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Objectives / Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to provide competitive compensation packages to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) attract and retain top-tier talent; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2) closely link potential compensation with our financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To meet these objectives our program emphasizes certain principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Connect executive compensation to financial measures that correlate strongly with stockholder returns;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Balance short-term operational goals and long-term strategic objectives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Reward achievement of challenging corporate objectives without encouraging inappropriate risk- taking;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Recognize the significant role our executive officers play in our overall performance and the responsibilities associated with their roles; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) Maintain sufficient flexibility to allow recognition of significant individual achievements by our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation packages for our Named Executive Officers are designed to reward achievement of both short-term and long-term goals, as reflected in specific financial measures and continued service to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Encouraging long-term service and continued financial achievement has created strong results for us as a Company and we have maintained steady growth and returns for our stockholders (see below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider our compensation package design to be integral to our success and believe the selected performance measures serve as significant indicators for our continued success, while use of time-based equity awards encourages stable and continuous leadership from our key talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee works closely with its independent compensation consultant and management to ensure that we maintain sound governance and compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In designing and overseeing our executive compensation program, we employ best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition to these policies and practices, the Compensation Committee stays informed and regularly assesses the alignment between our compensation packages and our performance as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular updates on our business results from management throughout the year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review of our quarterly financial statements, management projections, and long-range plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review of information regarding our peer group, including reported revenues, profit levels, market capitalization, stockholder returns, compensation components and disclosed governance policies and practices; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review of broader, general industry compensation data relative to other companies of our size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers management input, the advice of compensation consultants, and publicly available peer information to be valuable tools in its evaluation of the relationship between executive compensation and Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the outcome of our annual stockholder advisory vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers (the Say-on-Pay vote) in determining the design of our executive compensation program and the composition and levels of our individual compensation packages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, 84% of the votes cast on our Say-on-Pay proposal were voted in favor of the compensation program for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered these results when developing the compensation packages for fiscal 2016 as described in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Named Executive Officers were in compliance with the applicable ownership guideline during fiscal 2016.

sentences.text: Use of Compensation Consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retains Compensia, a national compensation consulting firm, to provide advice on compensation of our executive officers and the non-employee members of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this engagement, Compensia reports directly to the Compensation Committee and does no other work for the Company and the Compensation Committee maintains sole authority to determine the terms of Compensias retention and services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of the firm generally attends Compensation Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management interaction with Compensia is generally limited to communication of information provided by management to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management separately retains Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (Frederic Cook) to serve as its compensation consultant and assist in the preparation of information provided to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Weiss has final authority for the retention of Frederic Cook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of the firm generally attends Compensation Committee meetings as an invited guest, but Frederic Cook does no work directly for the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed the nature of the relationship between itself and Compensia as an independent consulting firm, and its relationship with the members of Compensia as individuals, for potential conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conducting this review, the Compensation Committee gave consideration to the factors identified by the SEC and the NYSE as possibly contributing to conflicts, including the scope of work performed for the Compensation Committee by Compensia, the fees paid to Compensia for services and any personal or business relationships between our executive officers or members of the Compensation Committee and Compensia or its individual members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review, the Compensation Committee has determined there are no conflicts of interest or potential conflicts of interest arising in connection with the Compensation Committees engagement of Compensia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frederic Cook provides the Compensation Committee with an annual report analyzing executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This report presents comparative compensation information based on peer group data and contains information regarding key trends in executive compensation for other comparable publicly-traded companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses this information as one factor in evaluating the design of our executive compensation program and the compensation elements and levels provided to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensia evaluates the recommendations provided by management and reviews the work done by Frederic Cook and advises the Compensation Committee on these findings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the annual compensation report, Mr. Weiss provides recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) selection of companies for the peer group (as described further below);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) base salary levels and increases for our executive officers, other than himsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) appropriate award targets and achievement under our Incentive Payment Plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) overall annual equity award levels, design and allocation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) special compensation awards to executive officers who have demonstrated outstanding performance during the fiscal year or on special projects, employment terms and arrangements and stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Weiss uses Frederic Cooks analyses and guidance to develop these recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee gives full consideration to his recommendations and reviews these ecommendations with Compensia before making its own decisions on the compensation of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Weiss does not participate in discussions of his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selects an appropriate peer group for understanding and assessing competitive compensation levels and practices within our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews this peer group annually, with consideration given to the recommendations and input of management, Frederic Cook, and Compensia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our peer group is drawn from publicly-traded companies headquartered in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations for peer group companies are based on similarity of product lines or industry and similarity in company size as measured by annual revenue, market capitalization, operating margins and other financial measures of organizational scope and complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, companies were considered for inclusion in the peer group that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) had revenue and/or a market capitalization between 0.5x and 2.0x of the Company in the past fiscal year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) were in the medical device industry,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and (iii) were identified as a peer by at least three other current peer companies, used the Company as a peer or had been identified as a peer by one of the major proxy advisory firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer group for fiscal 2016 was comprised of the following companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mettler-Toledo International, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PerkinElmer, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resmed, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sirona Dental Systems, Inc Steris Corporation Teleflex, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Varian Medical Systems, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Waters Corporation West Pharmaceutical Services, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed our peer group as part of its consideration of compensation planning for fiscal 2017 and removed Sirona Dental Systems, Inc. due to its merger with Dentsply International, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than that change, the peer group remains the same for fiscal 2017 compensation planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for our executive officers is determined based on their current role, recent changes to their responsibilities and overall execution of duties throughout the prior fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company performance, internal alignment among our executive officers, peer group compensation practices, and competitive market changes and conditions are also taken into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary elements of our executive compensation program are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Type of Compensation   Purpose  At Risk?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary     (cash)   Provide a minimum level of competitive compensation for our executives   Not at risk     Annual Incentive     (cash)   Encourage achievement of short-term business goals as reflected in our annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At risk     Performance-Based Equity Awards     (performance share awards)   Reward growth in long-term stockholder value through increases in non-GAAP EPS over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At risk     Time-Based Equity Awards     (stock option awards)   Encourage executive retention and link compensation to long- term stock price growth   At risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these elements, other than base salary, require achievement of strong financial results to realize significant (or any) amounts of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of this dependence on specific financial metrics (in the case of performance based equity and annual bonus) and significant increases in our stock price (in the case of time-vested equity), we consider these elements to be at risk for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the 2016 fiscal year, approximately 86% of Mr. Weisss target total direct compensation and approximately 83% of our other Named Executive Officers target total direct compensation was at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Payment Plan (IPP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves an annual Incentive Payment Plan, or IPP, to provide annual performance-based cash incentive opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target levels for the pre-established performance measures used in the IPP are based on budgeted goals reflected in our annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IPP is discussed in more detail in the narrative to the Grants of Plan Based Awards Table on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentives linked to specific, measurable, annual objectives encourage our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, to focus on immediate business objectives, generating annual growth, and stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target annual cash incentive opportunities for each Named Executive Officer are based on a combination of quantitative, pre-established targets for financial performance and discretionary recognition of other strategic, operational, and individual accomplishments not specifically quantified elsewhere in the IPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discretionary component allows the Compensation Committee the flexibility to reward individual and business achievements during the year or to recognize special circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes this flexibility is important to connect cash incentive awards with its assessment of executive achievement in individual roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2016 IPP, the annual cash incentives payable to our Named Executive Officers were based on our fiscal 2016 revenue, cash flow and non-GAAP EPS achievement, weighted as set forth in the accompanying chart, and the discretionary assessment of executive achievement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighting was based on the Compensation Committees prioritization of each quantitative measure for fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award Measures 2016 IPP    Weighting             Quantitative Factors                    Revenue     25%                Non-GAAP EPS     25%                Cash flow     25%          75%            Committee Discretion     25%          Total Target Award      100%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial targets were based on our annual operating plan, as approved by our Board of Directors at the beginning of fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targets were subject to adjustment for acquisitions and/or divestitures or other items during the fiscal year as determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discretionary component of awards is based entirely on the Compensation Committees assessment of executive performance during the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No award was payable with respect to any financial performance measure that did not reach its minimum achievement threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum achievement thresholds were set at 85% of the target level for cash flow and non-GAAP EPS and at 90% of the target level for revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, any two of the three quantitative measures were required to exceed 95% of their target level before awards for any quantitative performance measure could exceed 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each Named Executive Officer, the maximum incentive that can be paid for any individual financial performance measure, the discretionary component of awards, or for any total cash incentive was capped at 200% of his or her target annual cash incentive opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to approving the calculation of achievement based on financial results under the 2016 IPP (discussed in more detail below), the Compensation Committee also had the separate authority to adjust award amounts if it determined that payment based on our reported financial results was not merited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This determination would be based on any facts and circumstances the Compensation Committee considered to be in the Companys best interests and would permit the quantitative portion of annual cash incentives to be reduced by up to 25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award payments could also be reduced or cancelled by the Compensation Committee if a review of the results for the first two months of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: fiscal 2017 reflected anomalous unfavorable events that were attributable to fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee did not determine that any adjustments to awards for fiscal 2016 were necessary under these provisions.
