sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Measure Achievement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In approving the actual achievement levels for fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed managements presentation of our financial results and gave consideration to the events during the fiscal year that impacted budget targets and determined what adjustments, if any, would be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee agreed that results should be considered on a constant currency basis to account for the impact of foreign exchange fluctuations during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, as reported our non-GAAP EPS excluded the impact of amortization of intangible assets, costs associated to acquisitions and related business integration, facility start-up costs, specific litigation settlement and legal costs, and other exceptional or unusual charges and expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2016 IPP, our reported results provided a baseline calculation of non-GAAP EPS which could be adjusted at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used this discretion to exclude certain items related to integration costs, inventory write-offs and legal costs which were called out in our reported non-GAAP EPS for fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our reported non-GAAP EPS was $8.44, but our achievement for purposes of awards paid under the 2016 IPP was $7.70.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target levels for each of the financial performance measures, our actual achievement as approved by the Compensation Committee, and the associated award amounts earned with respect to each of these measures under the 2016 IPP is set out below, and a full discussion of our financial results can be found in Item 7, Managements Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016.

sentences.text: Discretionary Award Determinations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, the 2016 IPP provides for 25% of each Named Executive Officers target annual cash incentive opportunity to be entirely at the discretion of the Compensation Committee and not linked to the quantitative financial measures under the 2016 IPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining each executive officers achievement, the Compensation Committee made an independent assessment of individual performance and leadership, operational achievements not otherwise enumerated in the 2016 IPP,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and such other factors as the Compensation Committee considers indicative of executive performance, including market share growth, new product launches, business development, and executive leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally considers an award of the target 25% to be a reflection of satisfactory performance by an executive officer during the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee chose to make discretionary awards at the 25% target level for all Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination the Compensation Committee reviewed managements individual performance and our operational achievements in fiscal 2016 separate from the quantitative financial measures, including those described under The Year in Review on page 19 above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considered factors that negatively impacted our results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and its own assessment of the performance of our Named Executive Officers, the Compensation Committee concluded that discretionary awards at the 25% target level were warranted.

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses a combination of performance-based and time-vested equity awards to deliver long-term incentive compensation to our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes the combination of performance-based and time-vested awards maximizes retention value, effectively link our executive officers long-term compensation opportunities to stockholder gains, and controls cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee discusses appropriate award design with its compensation consultant and management to set challenging performance goals and award terms that drive a long-term focus on strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting award amounts for our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, the Compensation Committee considers recommendations from management and Frederic Cook, as well as advice from Compensia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as the Compensation Committee also reviews historical grant levels based on the role and position of each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers economic and accounting implications when determining the type and appropriate size of individual awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards are generally granted in the first quarter of the fiscal year, after financial results for the prior fiscal year are available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may also grant equity awards periodically to new hires, upon a promotion or in other circumstances, and to accomplish specific retention goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When such awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: are approved, the grant date is set by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant dates are never set prior to the date of approval by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, receive performance based equity awards that require achievement of pre-established increases in non-GAAP EPS over a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are designed to reflect the direct influence of our executive officers on our long-term financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has selected compounded non-GAAP EPS growth over a three year period as the performance measure for these awards due to its belief that this measure provides a strong link to stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this metric, achievement is determined based on our non-GAAP EPS as reported (see discussion above).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No shares will be earned under these awards unless the threshold level of achievement  10% growth over three years  is met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Results for Fiscal 2014 Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance period for the performance share awards granted in fiscal 2014 was completed at the end of fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our non-GAAP EPS growth over the performance period, the Compensation Committee certified achievement of the target level for these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers received 100% of the target number of shares of common stock subject to these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing achievement, the Compensation Committee considered our reported non-GAAP EPS for fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered changes to the way that non-GAAP EPS is calculated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the awards were granted in fiscal 2014, our reported non-GAAP EPS included amortization of intangibles and we have since begun to call this out, consistent with changes in industry practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee agreed that it would be necessary to consider a recalculated measure of non-GAAP EPS for fiscal 2014 in order to accurately determine growth over the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With foreign exchange impact fully off-set, our non-GAAP EPS would be $10.51, which would be outstanding achievement with the amortization call-out.

sentences.text: Time-Vested Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses time-based vesting to encourage executive retention while maintaining a link to long-term Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-based vesting requires continued service to benefit from these equity awards and the potential compensation realizable by our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, is dependent on increases in the market price of our common stock over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting award levels, the Compensation Committee considered competitive market practices and the analyses provided by Frederic Cook and Compensia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards vest ratably over a five-year period starting on the first anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also approved additional one-time awards to each of Messrs. McBride and White with a value of $1 million each.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are designed to strengthen long-term retention and are intended to support our succession planning efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To emphasize that purpose, the awards are designed to vest over a total of five years, but the initial vesting is deferred until the third anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards will then vest ratably on the third, fourth and fifth anniversaries of the date of grant.

sentences.text: Employee Benefits & Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers are eligible to receive benefits under programs provided to our employees generally, including participation in our 401(k) plan (with matching contributions up to a specified dollar value, set annually), benefits under our Retirement Income Plan (a defined benefit plan), health, life and disability insurance, and severance payments and benefits in accordance with our standard separation policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matching contributions to our 401(k) plan are equal to the matching contributions provided to employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the Retirement Income Plan are discussed in more detail in the Narrative to the Pension Benefits Table on page 44.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers also participate in our Change-in-Control Severance Plan, under which they have change in control agreements that provide for severance benefits if the participating executives were to be terminated within a specified time after a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements are discussed in more detail in the section titled Potential Payments on Termination or a Change in Control on page 45.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers also receive limited perquisites or other personal benefits, generally in the form of automobile allowances and expenses, income attributable to life insurance policies, and some limited reimbursement for spousal travel to business functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, the Compensation Committee reviews these amounts and takes them into consideration when reviewing overall executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We only provide perquisites or other personal benefits to our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, in situations where we believe it is appropriate to assist an individual in the performance of his or her duties, to make our executive officers more efficient and effective, and for recruitment and retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally provides that publicly held companies may not
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: deduct compensation in excess of $1 million paid in any fiscal year to its chief executive officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and the other three most highly compensated Named Executive Officers employed at the end of the year (other than its chief financial officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, pursuant to regulations issued by the U.S. Treasury Department, a limited exemption to the Section 162(m) deduction limit applies with respect to qualified performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers ways to maintain the tax deductibility of the compensation for our Named Executive Officers without limiting its discretion to compensate our executive officers in ways that will incentivize stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may choose to provide compensation which may not be deductible by reason of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity compensation plan is designed to be performance-based and the performance share awards granted to executives are intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted at or above market value are also intended to be performance-based compensation and deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, time-vested full value equity awards will not be qualified as performance-based and may not be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Incentive Payment Plan has not been approved by our stockholders and therefore payments under this plan do not qualify as performance-based compensation for purposes of Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has approved the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan to govern awards for fiscal 2017 and the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Incentive Plan is intended to qualify executive cash bonuses as performance-based compensation for purposes of IRC Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information regarding the Executive Incentive Plan is presented below in Proposal 3Approval of the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan on page 61.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conclusion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that each element of executive compensation and the total compensation provided to each of our Named Executive Officers is reasonable, competitive and appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of compensation payable to our Named Executive Officers depends largely on our financial performance and returns to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that our executive compensation program provides an appropriate mix of elements that will allow us to continue to attract, retain and motivate a top performing management team, without encouraging excessive or inappropriate risk-taking by our executive officers and that its compensation arrangements create incentives that drive our continue strong financial performance.

sentences.text: Annual Non-Equity Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee adopts an annual Incentive Payment Plan, or IPP, to govern short-term cash incentive awards tied to the achievement of our business goals, with targets derived from our approved fiscal year budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific targets and actual achievement under the 2016 IPP are discussed in more detail in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis on page 19.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also presenting the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan (the 2017 EIP) in this proxy statement for stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If approved, the 2017 EIP will govern annual cash incentives and will allow for such awards to potentially qualify for tax deductibility under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 EIP is discussed in more detail in Proposal 3-Approval of the 2017 Executive Incentive Plan on page 61.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation levels in the IPP are set by the Compensation Committee for our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targets represent a designated percentage of base salary for the fiscal year and that percentage controls the potential award that can be achieved under the IPP as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As presented in the Grants of Plan Based Awards Table, target amounts represent the potential bonus that would be paid on 100% achievement of quantitative factors and the discretionary portion of awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold amounts represent the minimum achievement necessary for payment on only the lowest weighted quantitative factor and no award of discretionary amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards are capped at a maximum of 200% of the target bonus opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant equity incentive awards as a tool to promote retention and to connect compensation with our long-term performance and stockholder returns.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee utilizes a mixture of equity award types, including stock options and performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are granted at 100% of fair market value on the date of grant and have a 10-year life.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options vest over a five-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards vest on the achievement of specified levels of earnings per share over a three-year performance period.

sentences.text: Our Retirement Income Plan was adopted in December 1983.

sentences.text: For services performed after December 31, 1988, members are entitled to an annual retirement benefit equal to 0.60% of base annual ompensation up to $10,000 and 1.20% of base annual compensation which exceeds $10,000 but is not n excess of the applicable annual maximum compensation permitted to be taken into account under nternal Revenue Service guidelines for each year of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors of a publicly traded company have substantial responsibilities and time commitments, and with ongoing changes in corporate governance standards, highly qualified and experienced directors are in high demand; therefore, we seek to provide suitable economic incentives for our directors and to compensate them appropriately for their continued performance, increased responsibilities and dedication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This compensation applies only to our Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Board who are also our employees receive no additional compensation for their service as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and recommends compensation amounts for our Non-Employee Directors, and the full Board approves compensation based on these recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers director responsibilities, compensation practices of our peer companies, and recommendations from its independent compensation consultant in making Non-Employee Director compensation program recommendations to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also receives an analysis from its independent compensation consultant regarding compensation of the Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and analyzes this information in determining whether to recommend changes to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board sets total Non-Employee Director compensation at levels it considers appropriate given the competitive market for qualified directors, peer group compensation of directors, and the time commitment and responsibilities expected of our Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation levels are reviewed at least annually and modified as the Board considers necessary or appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Non-Employee Directors receive cash compensation in the form of an annual stipend for their service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, directors who also serve as the Chair of a committee of the Board receive an additional annual stipend in recognition of this additional responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Non-Employee Directors also receive payment for each meeting attended, as well as compensation for time spent on company business and reimbursement for one day of travel in connection with meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Retainer for service as a Director:     $30,000   Lead Director     $40,000   Chairman of the Board     $125,000      Cash Retainer for service as a Committee Chair:    Audit Committee     $17,500   Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee     $10,000   Organization and Compensation Committee     $12,000   Science and Technology Committee     $10,000      Attendance at Meetings of the Board (per meeting):    In-Person Meetings & Telephonic Meetings lasting more than 2 hours      $2,000   Telephonic meetings lasting less than 2 hours      $1,000      Other Compensation:    Travel Days (one per set of scheduled meetings)      $2,000   Other time spent on Company business (per hour)      $250
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors appointed to or resigning from the Board mid-year are entitled to a prorated portion of the annual stipend based on the number of months of service provided for the fiscal year in which they enter or leave service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Non-Employee Directors are also eligible to receive annual equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that a significant equity component to Non-Employee Director compensation serves to align director and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant terms, including grant dates, award amounts, form of awards and vesting criteria are set by the terms of the 2006 Directors Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2006 Directors Plan was originally approved by stockholders on March 21, 2006, and was amended and restated in March 2009 and in March 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2006 Directors Plan provided for the following equity awards to each Non-Employee Director during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards were made in November 2015 as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Grant Date Fair Value(1) Award Type    Grant Date       Chairman      Lead Director      All Other Directors      Stock Options    November 1st      $ 148,500      $ 148,500      $ 135,000      Restricted Stock   November 15th     $ 148,500      $ 135,000      $ 135,000            Total Value:       $ 297,000      $ 283,500      $ 270,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Grant Date Fair Value of equity awards represents a target compensation amount and is used to calculate the actual number of options and restricted shares received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts are divided by the approximate fair value based on the closing price of our stock on the date of grant and rounded to the nearest whole number to set the number of options or restricted shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual compensation may be slightly above or below the amount shown depending on rounding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards vest on the first anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon vesting, all stock options become exercisable and all restrictions prohibiting sale are removed from the grant of restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are granted with an exercise price equal to 100% of the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Non-Employee Director ceases to serve on the Board, unless they are terminated for cause, the restrictions on any outstanding restricted stock awards will be lifted and any unvested stock options will become immediately vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outstanding stock options remain exercisable for three years from the date of cessation of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2006 Directors Plan was amended in October 2016 to change the form of annual awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2017 fiscal year and going forward, awards will be made in the form of Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards will have the same total value presented above and will be made on November 15th of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will vest on the first anniversary of the date of grant and if a director ends their term of service prior to the vesting date, the number of shares released under the award will be prorated according to the amount of the year actually served and the prorated amount of shares will be released on the original vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On appointment to the Board, new Non-Employee Directors will receive an equity grant as specified in the 2006 Directors Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This award will be prorated for the number of months of service remaining in the fiscal year in which they were appointed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional awards under the 2006 Directors Plan may be made at the Boards discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted stock ownership requirements for Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board adopted this requirement to strengthen the relationship between director and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors must hold Cooper common stock valued at five times their annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held must be free of restrictions to meet ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the required ownership values are met the Non-Employee Directors must retain 100% of shares received on vesting of stock awards or on exercise of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Non-Employee Directors were in compliance with the applicable ownership guideline during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws require that we have a minimum of six and maximum of eleven directors serving on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board sets the size of the board annually prior to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has fixed the number of directors to be elected at the Annual Meeting at nine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The names of the nominees presented for election as directors at the Annual Meeting are listed below, along with information regarding when they joined the Board, their present principal occupation, recent business experience and their service on other companies boards of directors.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3  APPROVAL OF THE 2017 EXECUTIVE INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors adopted the 2017 Executive Performance Plan in December 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Executive Performance Plan is referred to below as the 2017 EIP and was adopted on the recommendation of our Compensation Committee and subject to stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the full text of the 2017 EIP is presented as Exhibit A to this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based compensation is a key element of our compensation philosophy and certain of our executive officers are eligible for performance-based annual cash incentives awarded under our annual Incentive Payment Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual Incentive Payment Plans do not currently qualify for the performance-based compensation exception under Internal Revenue Code (IRC) Section 162(m) because the IPP was not previously stockholder approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are being asked to approve the 2017 EIP in order that our future short-term incentive awards (paid under the 2017 EIP) may be deductible for federal income tax purposes as performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IRC Section 162(m) generally provides that publicly-held companies may not take a federal income tax deduction for certain compensation in excess of $1,000,000 paid to the named executive officers (other than the chief financial officer) in any one year unless that compensation qualifies as performance-based compensation under IRC Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation can qualify as performance-based compensation under IRC Section 162(m) only if the material terms of the performance goals relating to such compensation are disclosed to and approved by stockholders at least every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms to be disclosed and approved at least every five years include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the employees eligible to receive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the business criteria on which the performance goals may be based; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the maximum amount of compensation that can be paid during a specified period to an employee subject to IRC Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these aspects is discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a brief summary of the material terms of the proposed 2017 EIP.

sentences.text: Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 EIP would be administered by our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will consist of at least two members, each of whom is an outside director within the meaning of IRC Section 162(m), and will be authorized to adopt such rules and guidelines as it may deem appropriate in order to carry out the purpose of the 2017 EIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All questions of interpretation, administration and application of the 2017 EIP will be determined by a majority of the members of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee could also authorize any one or more of its members, or any officer of the Company, to execute and deliver documents on behalf of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards may be granted only to employees of the Company or any of its subsidiaries who are selected for participation in the 2017 EIP by the Compensation Committee (each, a Participant).

sentences.text: Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee would be authorized to grant annual performance-based awards (Award or Awards) to Participants with respect to each fiscal year of the Company, a portion thereof, or any longer period as determined by the Committee (each such fiscal year, portion thereof, or other longer period to constitute a Performance Period), subject to the terms and conditions of the 2017 EIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards would be in the form of cash compensation, but may be settled in shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2017 EIP, within the earlier of either the date on which 25% of the Performance Period has been completed or 90 days after the beginning of a Performance Period, the Compensation Committee would establish for each Award:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) performance goals and objectives (Performance Targets) for the Company and the subsidiaries and divisions thereof for such Performance Period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) target awards (Target Awards) for each Participant, which would be a specified dollar amount; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) schedules or other objective methods for determining the applicable performance percentage (Performance Percentage) to be multiplied by each portion of the Target Award to which a Performance Target relates in arriving at the actual Award payout amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee would be authorized to specify the Performance Targets applicable to each Participant for each Performance Period and to further specify the portion of the Target Award to which each Performance Target will apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In no event will a Performance Schedule include a Performance Percentage in excess of 200% of the Target Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 EIP, if approved by stockholders, will be effective for fiscal 2017 Awards.

sentences.text: Limitations on Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Participant under the 2017 EIP may receive an Award that is greater than $3 million with respect to any Performance Period of one fiscal year, or a proportionate amount for a Performance Period longer or shorter than a fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there are two or more Performance Periods that coincide during any fiscal year, in no event shall the aggregate amount payable for all such Performance Periods exceed $10 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards may be settled in shares or in a combination of cash and shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the number of shares may not exceed the maximum number of shares that may be issued to any one individual pursuant to the terms of the Companys Third Amended and Restated 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan, as amended from time to time, or any successor stockholder approved plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be eligible to receive payment of an Award, the Participant must have remained in the continuous employ of the Company or its subsidiaries through the end of the applicable Performance Period or through the applicable payment date, as provided by the Compensation Committee, provided that, in the event the Participants employment terminates during the Performance Period due to death, disability or retirement, the Compensation Committee may, at its sole discretion, authorize the Company or the applicable subsidiary to pay in full or on a prorated basis an Award determined in accordance with the 2017 EIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the 2017 EIP:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) disability is defined in the employment practices or policies of the applicable subsidiary of the Company in effect at the time of termination of employment, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) retirement means termination of employment with all subsidiaries of the Company by the Participant after attainment of age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may at any time, and from time to time, alter, amend, suspend, or terminate the 2017 EIP in whole or in part.

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a brief summary of certain federal income tax consequences relating to the transactions described under the 2017 EIP as set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary does not purport to address all aspects of federal income taxation and does not describe state, local or foreign tax consequences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This discussion is based upon provisions of the IRC and the regulations issued thereunder, and judicial and administrative interpretations under the IRC and regulations, all as in effect as of the date hereof, and all of which are subject to change (possibly on a retroactive basis) or different interpretation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Consequences to Participants: Generally, the recipient of cash will be subject to tax at ordinary income rates on the amount of the award on the date of payment or delivery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any ordinary income realized by a Participant upon receipt of cash is subject to withholding of federal, state and local income tax and to withholding of the Participants share of employment taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Withholding does not represent an increase in the Participants total income tax obligation, since it is fully credited toward his or her tax liability for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Consequences to the Company: To the extent that a Participant recognizes ordinary income in the circumstances described above, the Company or a subsidiary of the Company for which the Participant performs services will be entitled to a corresponding deduction; provided that, among other things, the income meets the test of reasonableness, is an ordinary and necessary business expense and is not an excess parachute payment within the meaning of IRC Section 280G and otherwise meets the requirements of IRC Section 162(m) discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Law Affecting Deferred Compensation: IRC Section 409A would apply to any amounts under the 2017 EIP which payments are deferred beyond vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the requirements of IRC Section 409A are not satisfied and applicable correction opportunities are not available, deferred compensation and earnings thereon will be subject to tax as they vest, plus an interest charge at the underpayment rate plus 1% and a 20% penalty tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4  ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are requesting stockholder approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our Named Executive Officers as presented in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 19 and the compensation tables and associated narrative disclosure included in the discussion of Executive Compensation beginning on page 36.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program has been designed to retain and incentivize a talented, motivated, and focused executive team by providing compensation that is competitive within our market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program provides an appropriate balance between salary and at-risk forms of incentive compensation, as well as a mix of incentives that encourage executive focus on both short-term and long-term goals as a company without encouraging inappropriate risks to achieve performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were pleased to receive a favorable vote for our compensation practices at our 2016 Annual Meeting, with 84% of the votes cast by our stockholders on our Say-on-Pay proposal voted in favor of the compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider these voting results to affirm stockholder support for our compensation practices and we continue to take steps to maintain alignment between executive pay and Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of our executive compensation program include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A mixture of salary and incentive compensation that provides for a significant portion of executive compensation to be at-risk and dependent on our performance as a company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Checks and balances within our compensation packages to balance focus on both short-term and long-term goals, encouraging our executives to focus on the health of the company both during the immediate fiscal year and for the future;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation on termination of employment, other than resulting from a change in control, is limited for most executives to the standard severance policies used for all employees; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback provisions in our short-term incentive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding upon us as a Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Compensation Committee, which is responsible for the design and administration of our executive compensation practices, values the opinions of our stockholders as expressed through your vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will consider the outcome of this vote in making future compensation decisions for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we will present the following resolution for vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of The Cooper Companies, Inc. (the Company) approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and disclosed in the Summary Compensation Table and related compensation tables and narrative disclosure as set forth in our Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of our executive compensation program as presented in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5  ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF PRESENTATION OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM FOR AN ADVISORY VOTE OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are requesting that our stockholders vote, on an advisory basis, on the frequency with which we present a request for an advisory vote on our executive compensation practices in our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are asked to consider whether we should present an advisory vote on our executive compensation every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be requested to provide an advisory vote on this topic at least every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize that there are advantages and disadvantages to each of the presented options for the frequency of an advisory vote on executive compensation, and we are recommending that our stockholders select an ANNUAL advisory vote on our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although our executive compensation practices change very little from year to year, we feel it is valuable for our stockholders to have an opportunity to express their opinion on our practices on a regular basis and for us to receive feedback on our programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board of Directors recommends a vote every year, stockholders will be able to specify one of four choices for this proposal on the proxy card: one year, two years, three years or to abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are not voting to approve or disapprove of the Boards recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this vote is advisory and not binding on the Board of Directors or the Company in any way, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our stockholders and the Company to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the option approved by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we value the opinions of our stockholders and we will consider the outcome of the vote in making determinations regarding the presentation of vote proposals in future proxy statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote for an ANNUAL frequency for the presentation of an advisory vote on our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency of presentation of an advisory vote on our executive compensation program will be selected by the affirmative vote of the plurality of the shares represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of annual, biennial or triennial that receives the highest number of advisory votes cast by stockholders will be considered to be the stockholder choice for the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will not affect the outcome of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of The Cooper Companies, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Incentive Program (the Plan) are to attract, retain, motivate and reward highly qualified individuals as executive officers and key employees by providing them with the opportunity to earn competitive compensation linked to the performance of The Cooper Companies, Inc. (the Company) and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Companys intent that awards made under the Plan may be designed to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan shall be administered by the Organization & Compensation Committee of the Companys Board of Directors (the Committee) or such other committee or subcommittee of the Companys Board of Directors as the Companys Board of Directors shall designate from time to time, consisting of at least two members, each of whom shall be an outside director within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Code.

sentences.text: The Committee shall adopt such rules and guidelines as it may deem appropriate in order to carry out the purpose of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All questions of interpretation, administration and application of the Plan shall be determined by a majority of the members of the Committee then in office, except that the Committee may authorize any one or more of its members, or any officer of the Company, to execute and deliver documents on behalf of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The determination of the majority shall be final and binding in all matters relating to the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have authority to determine the terms and conditions of the Awards granted to eligible persons specified in Section 1.3 below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 1.3 Eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of each Fiscal Year, or as otherwise appropriate, the Committee which may delegate this authority to Executive Management for selection of non-executive officer reporting levels, will identify eligible participants and classify each into a category indicating his or her incentive opportunity for achievement of established goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A qualifying employee so selected shall be a Participant in the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Article 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.1 Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may grant performance-based awards (Awards) to Participants with respect to each fiscal year of the Company, a portion thereof, or any longer period as determined by the Committee (each such fiscal year, portion thereof, or other longer period to constitute a Performance Period), subject to the terms and conditions of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the right in its sole discretion to grant any Awards in cash, in shares of the Companys common stock under the Companys Third Amended and Restated 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan, as amended from time to time, or any successor plan as approved by stockholders in compliance with Section 162(m) of the Code, thereto (the Equity Incentive Plan), in other awards under the Equity Incentive Plan, or in any combination thereof, up to the maximum award payable under Section 2.5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within the earlier of the date on which 25% of the Performance Period has been completed and 90 days after the beginning of a Performance Period, and while the outcome as to the performance goals and objectives is substantially uncertain, the Committee shall establish (a) performance goals and objectives (Performance Targets) for the Company and the subsidiaries and divisions thereof
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for such Performance Period,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) target awards (Target Awards) for each Participant, which shall be a specified dollar amount or percentage of a Participants base salary, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) schedules or other objective methods for determining the applicable performance percentage (Performance Percentage) to be multiplied by each portion of the Target Award to which a Performance Target relates in arriving at the actual Award payout amount pursuant to Section 2.4 (Performance Schedules).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall specify the Performance Targets applicable to each Participant for each Performance Period and shall further specify the portion of the Target Award to which each Performance Target shall apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.2 Performance Targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Targets established by the Committee each year shal be based on one or more variations of the following business criteria: (a) net earnings or losses (either before or after one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) interest,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) net income (either be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) adjusted net income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) operating earnings [o
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) cash flow (including, but not limited to, operating cash flow and free cash flow);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) return on assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) return on capital (
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) return on sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) gross or net prof
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) costs, reductions in costs and cost control measures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) expenses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q) adjusted earnings or loss per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (r) price per share or dividends per shar
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (s) regulatory achievements or compliance (including, without limitation, regulatory body approval for commercialization of a product);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (t) implementation or completion of critical projects;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (u) market share; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) economic value added.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Targets that are financial metrics may be determined in accordance with applicable accounting principles or financial metrics that are based on, or able to be derived from such applicable accounting principles, and may be adjusted when established (or to the extent permitted under Section 162(m) of the Code, at any time thereafter) to include or exclude any items otherwise includable or excludable under applicable accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any Performance Period, Performance Targets may be measured on an absolute or relative basis, on an aggregate or per share basis, or by reference to an index or indices or other measures and may be based on or otherwise employ comparisons based on internal targets, the performance of the Company (including the performance of one or more subsidiaries, divisions, segments, lines of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business, or operating units or with respect to continuing operations or on a consolidated basis) or the performance of other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, the Committee retains the ability to exercise negative discretion to reduce the actual Award payout based on subjective determinations or other objective performance metrics that may be established concurrently or at a later date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to an Award that the Committee has determined should not constitute qualified performance-based compensation for purposes of Code Section 162(m), Performance Targets means any of the above criteria or any other business measurement of the Company (including the performance of one or more subsidiaries, divisions, segments, lines of business, or operating units or with respect to continuing operations or on a consolidated basis) or any other objective or subjective criteria, that the Committee in its discretion shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.3 Employment Requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be eligible to receive payment of an Award, the Participant must have remained in the continuous employ of the Company or its subsidiaries through the end of the applicable Performance Period or through the applicable payment date, as provided by the Committee, provided that, in the event the Participants employment terminates during the Performance Period due to death, disability or retirement, the Committee may, at its sole discretion, authorize the Company or the applicable subsidiary to pay in full or on a prorated basis an Award, subject to satisfaction of the requirements of Code Section 162(m), determined in accordance with Sections 2.4 and 2.5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Section 2.3,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) disability shall be as defined in the employment practices or policies of the applicable subsidiary of the Company in effect at the time of termination of employment, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) retirement shall mean retirement from consulting or active employment with the Company and any Subsidiary or Affiliate on or after age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.4 Determination of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the manner required by Section 162(m) of the Code, the Committee shall, promptly after the date on which the necessary financial or other information for a particular Performance Period becomes available, certify the extent to which Performance Targets have been achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the Performance Schedules, the Committee shall determine the Performance Percentage applicable to each Performance Target and multiply the portion of the Target Award to which the Performance Target relates by such Performance Percentage in order to arrive at the actual Award payout for such portion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.5 Limitations on Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Participant shall receive a payment with respect to an Award under the Plan with respect to any Performance Period of one fiscal year having a value in excess of $3 million; provided, however, that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) such maximum amount shall be proportionately adjusted with respect to Performance Periods that are less than or greater than one fiscal year in duration, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) if there are two or more Performance Periods that coincide during any fiscal year, in no event shall the aggregate amount payable to any Participant with respect to all such Performance Periods for such calendar year exceed $10 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, in its discretion, may elect to settle an Award in cash, shares or a combination of cash and shares, provided that the number of shares issued shall be limited by the provisions of the Equity Incentive Plan regarding the maximum number of shares to be issued in a given period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.6 Payment of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Awards shall be made by the Company or the applicable employer subsidiary as soon as administratively practicable following the certification by the Committee of the extent to which the applicable Performance Targets have been achieved and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the determination of the actual Awards in accordance with Sections 2.4 and 2.5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Awards under the Plan are subject to withholding, where applicable, for federal, state and local taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company intends that the Awards under the Plan shall be exempt from Code Section 409A and shall not constitute deferred compensation within the meaning of Code Section 409A (absent a valid deferral election under the terms of another plan or arrangement maintained by the Company or its subsidiaries).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan shall be interpreted, construed and administered in accordance with the foregoing intent, so as to avoid the imposition of taxes and penalties on Participants pursuant to Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any Awards under the Plan or any other plan or arrangement that would be aggregated with the Plan under Section 409A are deferred compensation subject to Section 409A, and such amounts are payable upon the Participants separation from service within the meaning of Section 409A, then payment of such amounts will be delayed until the Companys next regularly scheduled payroll cycle following the six month anniversary of the Participants separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall have no liability to any Participant, any Participants spouse or otherwise if the Plan or any amounts paid or payable hereunder are subject to the additional tax and penalties under Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.7 Adjustment of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to Section 3.7, the Committee, in its sole discretion, may provide that one or more objectively determinable adjustments shall be made to one or more of the Performance Targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such adjustments may include, but are not limited to, one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) items related to a change in Applicable Accounting Standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) items relating to financing activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) expenses for restructuring or productivity initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) other non-operating items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) items related to acquisitions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) items attributable to the business operations of any entity acquired by the Company during the Performance Period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) items related to the sale or disposition of a business or segment of a business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) items related to discontinued operations that do not qualify as a segment of a business under Applicable Accounting Standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) items attributable to any stock dividend, stock split, combination or exchange of stock occurring during the Performance Period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) any other items of significant income or expense which are determined to be appropriate adjustments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xi) items relating to unusual or extraordinary corporate transactions, events or developments,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xii) items related to amortization of acquired intangible assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xiii) items that are outside the scope of the Companys core, on-going business activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xiv) items related to acquired in-process research and development;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xv) items relating to changes in tax laws;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xvi) items relating to major licensing or partnership arrangements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xvii) items relating to asset impairment charges;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xviii) items relating to gains or losses for litigation, arbitration and contractual settlements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xix) items attributable to expenses incurred in connection with a reduction in force or early retirement initiative;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xx) items relating to foreign exchange or currency transactions and/or fluctuations; or (xxi) items relating to any other unusual or nonrecurring events or changes in applicable law, Applicable Accounting Standards or infrequently occurring business conditions (including those described in the Financial Accounting Standards Boards authoritative guidance, footnotes to the Companys financial statements and/or in managements discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations appearing in the Companys reports on Form 10-K, 10-Q or 8-K for the applicable year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All such determinations and adjustments shall be made within the time prescribed by, and otherwise in compliance with, Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such adjustment shall be made as is necessary to prevent reduction or enlargement of Participants Awards under the Plan for such Performance Period attributable to such transaction, change, or event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such adjustments shall be conclusive and binding for all purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Article 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Miscellaneous.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.1 No Rights to Awards or Continued Employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employee of the Company or any of its subsidiaries shall have any claim or right to receive Awards under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the Plan nor any action taken under the Plan shall be construed as giving any employee any right to be retained by the Company or any subsidiary of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.2 No Limits on Other Awards and Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing contained in this Plan shall prohibit the Company or any of its subsidiaries from establishing other special awards or incentive compensation plans providing for the payment of incentive compensation to employees of the Company and its subsidiaries, including any Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.3 Restriction on Transfer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rights of a Participant with respect to Awards under the Plan shall not be transferable by the Participant other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.4 Source of Payments; ERISA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and its subsidiaries shall not have any obligation to establish any separate fund or trust or other segregation of assets to provide for payments under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent any person acquires any rights to receive payments hereunder from the Company or any of its subsidiaries, such rights shall be no greater than those of an unsecured creditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is not intended to be subject to the Employee Retirement Income and Security Act of 1974, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.5 Effective Date; Term; Amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is effective for any Award granted on or after November 1, 2016 subject to approval by the Companys stockholders at the Companys 2017 annual meeting of stockholders, and shall remain in effect until the annual meeting of stockholders occurring in 2022 or such earlier time as it shall be terminated by the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may at any time and from time to time alter, amend, suspend or terminate the Plan in whole or in part; provided, however, Plan amendments may be conditioned on the Companys stockholders approval to the extent the Board of Directors determines such approval is required by law or is desirable and necessary for Awards to qualify as performance- based compensation under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.6 Prohibited or Unenforceable Provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any provision of the Plan that is prohibited or unenforceable shall be ineffective to the extent of such prohibition or unenforceability without invalidating the remaining provisions of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Board of Directors may amend the Plan from time to time as set forth in Section 3.5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.7 Section 162(m) Provisions; Non-Performance Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Awards made to covered employees within the meaning of Code Section 162(m) under the Plan, and that are designated as Awards that are intended to constitute qualified performance-based compensation under Code Section 162(m), shall be subject to the applicable restrictions imposed by Code Section 162(m) and the Treasury Regulations promulgated thereunder, notwithstanding any other provisions of the Plan to the contrary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in this Plan shall preclude the Committee, the Company, or any subsidiary from granting Awards that are not intended to be qualified performance-based compensation under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.8 Other Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments of Awards pursuant to the Plan shall not be treated as compensation for purposes of any other compensation or benefit plan, program or arrangement of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Company or any of its subsidiaries, unless either
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) such other plans definition of compensation includes payments made pursuant to the Plan or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the Board of Directors or the Committee so determines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.9 Forfeiture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company is required to file restated quarterly or annual financial statements due to the Companys material noncompliance with generally accepted accounting principles or any financial reporting requirement under the securities laws, the Company shall have the right to recover from any Participant who is a current or former executive officer of the Company who received payment of an Award during the three-year period preceding the time period for which the Company is required to file an accounting restatement, based on erroneous data, the amount in excess of what would have been paid to the executive officer under the accounting restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards are also subject to the Companys clawback policies and any successor or replacement policies thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to forfeiture for the reasons specified in this Section 3.9, the Participant shall forfeit and disgorge to the Company any Award amounts to the extent required by applicable law or regulation including, without limitation, the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and any rules or regulations promulgated thereunder, whether or not such clawback policy was in place at the time of grant of an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3.10 Governing Law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan and all rights and Awards hereunder shall be construed in accordance with and governed by the laws of the State of California.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
